product_name: KALANDO Wireless Bluetooth Colorful LED Water Speaker with Dancing Fountain Light Show Sound for PC, MP3 Player, Laptops, Smartphone Black
explanation: The CO2e emissions for the KALANDO Wireless Bluetooth Water Speaker were estimated based on a cradle-to-grave life cycle assessment (LCA). Key factors considered include: 1) Materials: The product likely contains plastics (ABS or polycarbonate), electronic components (PCB, lithium-ion battery, LEDs), and small metal parts. The emission factor for plastics is ~5 kg CO2e/kg, electronics ~30 kg CO2e/kg, and metals ~10 kg CO2e/kg. 2) Manufacturing: Assumed to occur in China, with energy-intensive processes like injection molding and PCB assembly. 3) Transportation: Estimated shipping from China to the US by sea (~0.1 kg CO2e/kg). 4) Use phase: Low power consumption (~5W) but frequent use of LEDs and water pump increases emissions. 5) End-of-life: Likely landfilled or incinerated (high emissions). The total weight (1.11 lbs ≈ 0.5 kg) and typical electronic product LCAs suggest ~25.5 kg CO2e, with manufacturing (60%) and materials (30%) as major contributors. Assumptions align with IPCC 2021 factors and industry LCA databases like Ecoinvent.

product_name: Diamond ATI Radeon HD5870 Eyefinity 6 Edition 2048 MB GDDR5 PCI-Express Video Card 5870PE52G
explanation: The CO2e emissions for the Diamond ATI Radeon HD5870 graphics card are estimated based on its life cycle, including manufacturing, use, and end-of-life phases. The manufacturing phase is the most significant contributor, accounting for approximately 200 kg CO2e, due to the energy-intensive production of semiconductors, PCB, and other components. The use phase contributes around 80 kg CO2e, assuming an average power consumption of 150W and a lifespan of 4 years with moderate usage. The end-of-life phase contributes about 20 kg CO2e, considering recycling and disposal processes. These estimates are based on reference factors from recent LCA studies of similar electronic products and industry standards.

product_name: Case for iPad Pro 12.9 2022/2021/2020/2018, Blue Flowers Shockproof Protective Case for iPad Pro 12.9 6th/5th/4th/3rd Gen, [Auto Sleep/Wake] [with Pencil Holder] Adjustable Stand iPad Case Folio Cover
explanation: The product is a protective case for an iPad Pro, primarily made of PU leather (polyurethane) and TPU (thermoplastic polyurethane), with a microfiber interior. Based on LCA data for similar electronic accessories, the emissions are estimated as follows: 1) Material production (PU leather ~1.2 kg CO2e/kg, TPU ~3.5 kg CO2e/kg, microfiber ~5 kg CO2e/kg), weighted by approximate material composition (60% PU, 30% TPU, 10% microfiber). 2) Manufacturing (injection molding/assembly) adds ~0.5 kg CO2e. 3) Transportation (assumed sea freight from Asia to US) adds ~0.3 kg CO2e. 4) End-of-life (landfill/incineration) adds ~0.5 kg CO2e. The total is rounded to 2.5 kg CO2e, considering the product's lightweight (0.54 kg) and typical emissions for such cases. Assumptions align with IPCC and Ecoinvent data for electronic accessories.

product_name: Lenovo Thinkpad T440S 14" FHD Touchscreen Ultrabook Laptop Computer, Intel Core i5-4200U up to 2.6GHz, 8GB RAM, 240GB SSD, WiFi, Bluetooth, USB 3.0, Windows 10 Professional (Renewed)
explanation: The CO2e emissions for the Lenovo Thinkpad T440S were estimated based on a cradle-to-grave life cycle assessment (LCA). Key factors considered include: 1) Manufacturing phase (70% of total emissions), accounting for materials like aluminum, plastics, and electronics (SSD, RAM, etc.), with an estimated 210 kg CO2e. 2) Use phase (20%), assuming a 4-year lifespan with moderate usage (1,460 kWh energy consumption, based on 1 kWh/day and EU grid emission factor of 0.3 kg CO2e/kWh). 3) End-of-life (10%), accounting for recycling and disposal emissions. The product being 'Renewed' reduces virgin material use, lowering emissions by ~15% compared to new. Assumptions align with industry standards (e.g., Ecoinvent, IPCC) and peer-reviewed LCA studies for similar laptops. Missing data (e.g., supply chain specifics) was supplemented with averages from comparable products.

product_name: Ceeyali Reusable Hook and Loop Fastening Cable Ties Cable Straps for Home Office Tablet PC TV Electronics Wires Organizer Management (15 Pack 8 inch + 15 Pack 12 inch)
explanation: The product is a set of reusable hook and loop fastening cable ties made from fabric material (likely polyester or nylon, given the description). The CO2e emissions are estimated based on the following life cycle stages: 1) Material production: Fabric material has an emission factor of approximately 5-10 kg CO2e/kg (mid-range of 7.5 kg CO2e/kg used). Assuming an average weight of 3.2 oz (0.09 kg) for the entire pack, material production contributes ~0.68 kg CO2e. 2) Manufacturing: Energy use for cutting and sewing fabric is minimal, estimated at 0.1 kg CO2e. 3) Transportation: Assuming production in Asia and shipping to the US, emissions are ~0.05 kg CO2e. 4) Use phase: Reusable nature reduces need for replacements, but washing (if any) is negligible. 5) End-of-life: Fabric is not biodegradable, but recycling or landfill emissions are minimal (~0.02 kg CO2e). Total is adjusted downward due to reusable design (avoiding multiple plastic ties). Missing exact material composition, but fabric-based ties generally have lower emissions than plastic alternatives.

product_name: HYS 3.5mm Police Listen Only Acoustic Tube Earpiece with One Pair Medium Earmolds for Speaker Mics
explanation: The product is a simple wired earpiece made primarily of rubber (silicone) and small electronic components. Based on similar small electronic accessories, the CO2e emissions are estimated as follows: 1) Material production (rubber and small metal/plastic parts) ~1.2 kg CO2e, 2) Manufacturing (injection molding, assembly) ~0.8 kg CO2e, 3) Transportation (from China to US) ~0.3 kg CO2e, and 4) End-of-life (assumed landfill disposal) ~0.2 kg CO2e. The low weight (0.04 lbs) and simple design contribute to lower emissions compared to more complex electronics. Assumptions are based on industry averages for small electronic accessories from recent LCA databases (Ecoinvent, 2023).

product_name: ASUS VivoBook Thin and Light Laptop, 15.6" HD Display, Intel Core i3-1005G1 Processor, USB Type-C, Webcam, Wi-Fi, HDMI, Windows 11 Home, Gray (12GB RAM | 256GB SSD)
explanation: The CO2e emissions for the ASUS VivoBook laptop are estimated based on a cradle-to-grave life cycle assessment (LCA). Key factors considered include: 1) Manufacturing: The laptop's components (e.g., Intel Core i3 processor, 12GB DDR4 RAM, 256GB SSD, 15.6" HD display) contribute significantly to emissions, with semiconductors and electronics manufacturing being energy-intensive. Reference data suggests ~200-300 kg CO2e for similar laptops. 2) Materials: The laptop likely contains plastics, aluminum, and other metals, with emissions from extraction and processing. 3) Use phase: Assuming a 4-year lifespan and moderate usage (8 hours/day, 50W power draw), emissions are ~50 kg CO2e (U.S. grid average). 4) End-of-life: Recycling offsets some emissions (~-20 kg CO2e). The total is aligned with industry averages for mid-range laptops (e.g., 300-400 kg CO2e) and peer-reviewed LCA studies. Missing data (e.g., supply chain specifics) was supplemented with IPCC and Ecoinvent database factors.

product_name: SMDV Diffuser-50 -- Professional 20x20" Rigid Softbox for Canon Flash
explanation: The SMDV Diffuser-50 is primarily composed of rip-stop nylon (for the softbox shell and diffusers), fiberglass (for the frame), and likely some metal components (e.g., speed ring, 'L' bracket, locking screws). The CO2e estimate is based on the following assumptions and calculations: 1) Rip-stop nylon production emits ~5.5 kg CO2e/kg (including silver coating for reflection). 2) Fiberglass production emits ~3.5 kg CO2e/kg. 3) Metal components (assuming aluminum) emit ~8 kg CO2e/kg. Given the product's weight (2.65 lbs ≈ 1.2 kg), we estimate material breakdown: ~0.6 kg nylon, ~0.4 kg fiberglass, ~0.2 kg metal. Manufacturing (assembly, transportation of materials) adds ~20% to material emissions. End-of-life (landfill/incineration) adds minimal emissions due to lightweight materials. The total is weighted toward nylon due to its higher emission factor and dominant use in the product. Uncertainty is moderate due to lack of precise material composition data, but this aligns with similar photography accessories in LCA databases.

product_name: RasTech Raspberry Pi 3 Model B+ Starter Kit with 32GB Micro SD Card, Power Supply with ON/Off, Case, Micro SDHC Card, Cooling Fan, HDMI Cable, Network Cable, Hestsinks, Card Reader, Screwdriver
explanation: The CO2e emissions for the RasTech Raspberry Pi 3 Model B+ Starter Kit were estimated based on a cradle-to-grave life cycle assessment (LCA). The main contributors to emissions include: 1) Manufacturing of the Raspberry Pi board (primarily silicon, plastics, and metals), estimated at 8 kg CO2e based on similar single-board computers. 2) Production of accessories (32GB microSD card, power supply, case, cooling fan, etc.), estimated at 5 kg CO2e. 3) Transportation (assuming air freight from Asia to the US), estimated at 1 kg CO2e. 4) Use phase (assuming 3 years of operation at 5W average power draw with a global average electricity mix), estimated at 1 kg CO2e. 5) End-of-life (assuming 50% recycling and 50% landfill), estimated at 0.2 kg CO2e. The total was rounded to 15.2 kg CO2e, with uncertainties due to lack of specific manufacturing data and regional electricity mix details.

product_name: USB 3.0 Extension Cable 20Ft, TanGuYu USB 3.0 Extender Cord Type A Male to A Female for Oculus VR, Playstation, Xbox, USB Flash Drive, Card Reader, Hard Drive,Keyboard, Printer, Scanner, Camera
explanation: The USB 3.0 extension cable is primarily composed of PVC (for insulation and jacket), copper (for conductors), and gold (for plating connectors). Based on life cycle assessment (LCA) data for similar electronic cables, the CO2e emissions are estimated as follows: 1) Material production (PVC ~1.2 kg CO2e/kg, copper ~4 kg CO2e/kg, gold ~12,000 kg CO2e/kg) contributes ~1.8 kg CO2e. 2) Manufacturing (extrusion, assembly) adds ~0.5 kg CO2e. 3) Transportation (assuming sea freight from China to the US) adds ~0.1 kg CO2e. 4) End-of-life (landfill or incineration) adds ~0.1 kg CO2e. The total is rounded to 2.5 kg CO2e, considering the cable's weight (7 oz) and typical emissions for such products. Assumptions are based on industry averages and Ecoinvent data.
